links.description: A set of links to traverse the result set

is_subscribed.description: Whether the affected company is still subscribed.

rating.description: Current rating of the affected company if it is subscribed, otherwise null.

company_custom_id.description: A customer provided custom id for the organization

category.description: The category of alert if this is an INFORMATIONAL, SERVICE_PROVIDER or PUBLIC_DISCLOSURE alert

effective_date.description: The effective date the public disclosure was added to the Bitsight platform, if this is PUBLIC_DISCLOSURE or a FP_PUBLIC_DISCLOSURE alert

end_grade.description: The grade after the alert triggered if this is a RISK_CATEGORY or NIST_CATEGORY alert

end_rating.description: The conmpany's security rating after the alert triggered if this is a PERCENT_CHANGE or RATING_THRESHOLD alert.

nist_category.description: The NIST CSF category (i.e. 'RS.MI') of the NIST_CATEGORY alert

nist_category_display_name.description: The NIST CSF category display name (i.e. 'Mitigation') of this NIST_CATEGORY alert

rating_change_pct.description: The percent change in security scores if this is a PERCENT_CHANGE alert.

rating_threshold.description: The rating threshold that was crossed to generate the alert if this is a RATING_THRESHOLD alert.

risk_vector.description: The risk vector that this alert is for if this is a RISK_CATEGORY alert.

start_grade.description: The grade before the alert triggered if this is a RISK_CATEGORY or NIST_CATEGORY alert

start_rating.description: The company's security rating before the alert triggered if this is a PERCENT_CHANGE or RATING_THRESHOLD alert.

threshold_grade.description: The grade that was reached or crossed to generate the RISK_CATEGORY or NIST_CATEGORY alert

folder_name.description: The name of the folder that this alert was for

severity.description: The severity level of the alert.

links.description: A set of links to traverse the result set

name.description: The name of the industry sector

slug.description: The slug name of the industry sector

name.description: The name of the company's current life cycle, e.g. "Onboarding"

slug.description: The slug name of the company's current life cycle

name.description: The name of the company's relationship to the requestor, e.g. "Vendor"

slug.description: The slug name of the company's relationship to the vendor

company.description: Associated company, if the request was fulfilled successfuly

can_subscribe.description: Indicates if you can subscribe the company

can_view.description: Indicates if you have permission to view the company

in_portfolio.description: Indicates if the company is subscribed

is_bundle.description: Indicates if the company is a ratings bundle

self_published.description: When the company is self published, indicates if its private or public

domain.description: The primary domain representing the requested organization

requester.description: User who made the company request

subscription_type.description: Optional subscription type, used if we want to subscribe a company when the request is fulfilled

CompanyRequestsResponse.description: A paginated set of company requests

links.description: A set of links to traverse the result set

slug.description: The slug name of the sub-industry

name.description: The name of the company's subscription type, e.g. "Total Risk Monitoring"

slug.description: The slug name of the company's subscription type

FQOutput.description: Output data returned by the model. For legacy FQs, in the case of the level1 output, these fields will all be empty and in the case of level2_3, annualized_loss will be empty. Signals and scores will always be empty for legacy, as well.
FQOutput.title: FQOutput

FQOutputLevel.description: For Legacy, in the case of the level1 output, these fields will all be empty and in the case of level2_3, annualized_loss will be empty.
FQOutputLevel.title: FQOutputLevel

FQOutputResponse.description: Summary of a financial quantification output
FQOutputResponse.title: FQOutputResponse

Portfolio.description: A paginated set of companies in a user's portfolio

links.description: A set of links to traverse the result set

custom_id.description: A customer provided custom id for the organization

display_url.description: The full URL for the organization's Security Ratings page on Bitsight

logo.description: URL that contains the organization's official logo

network_size_v4.description: The number of IPv4 addresses attributed to the organization

rating_date.description: The date of the latest rating for this company

tier.description: The guid of the tier that this company is in, or None of it is not in a tier

tier_name.description: The name of the tier that this company is in, or None of it is not in a tier

tier_order.description: The order of the tier that this company is in, or None of it is not in a tier

type.description: Type(s) of organization as classified by Bitsight

PortfolioSummaries.description:
A mapping of field to an array of filter values for that field. The
ordering of each array is arbitrary.

countries.description: All of the countries that appear in your portfolio

industries.description: All of the industries that appear in your portfolio

infections.description: All of the infections that appear in your portfolio

open_ports.description: All of the open ports that appear in your portfolio

product_types.description: All of the 4th party product types that appear in your portfolio

products.description: All of the 4th party products that appear in your portfolio

providers.description: All of the 4th party providers that appear in your portfolio

software.description: All of the software names that appear in your portfolio

subscription_types.description: All of the subscription types that appear in your portfolio

types.description: All of the rating types that appear in your portfolio

vulnerabilities.description: All of the vulnerabilities that appear in your portfolio

Questionnaire.description: Optional fields to allow users to save partially completed draft questionnaires.
Questionnaire.title: Questionnaire

email_preferences.description: The email preferences settings for the user (only return for current user).

compromised_system_alerts.description: whether the user will receive event alert emails.

notifications.description: a list of the different notification types that the user will receive email for

annotation.description: Email alerts for comments that mentions the user.

company_request.description: company requests by the user or other users within the same company if admin

folder.description: when a folder has been shared with the user or deleted

issue_tracking.description: when a finding has been assigned to the user

report.description: when a pdf report download is ready

real_time_alerts.description: fields for if/when the user will receive real time alert emails

alerts_period.description: the frequency of which the user will receive the alert emails

is_enabled.description: if the user will receive the email

can_update.description: If the feature value can be updated for this user

group.description: Group that the user belongs to

is_available_for_contact.description: Indicates if the user is set as a customer contact

is_company_api_token.description: Indicates if it is a token user

last_login_time.description: Last time the user logged in

preferred_contact_for_entities.description: List of entities of which the user is a preferred contact

links.description: A set of links to traverse the result set
